sentence.Network_en: My gargantuan, pristine machine was good for writing papers and playing solitaire, and that was all.
sentence.Network_cn: 我那庞大的 、 早期的计算机只适合写文章和玩纸牌游戏, 就这些.

sentence.Network_en: Falk even persuaded Nike to spend at least $ 1 million marketing Jordan, a gargantuan sum at the time.
sentence.Network_cn: 福尔克甚至说服耐克公司至少花了100万美元去推销乔丹, 这在当时是一笔巨额款项.

sentence.Network_en: Right away, I realized this was a mistake of gargantuan proportions.
sentence.Network_cn: 我立刻意识到这是一个巨大的错误.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 2013年8月14日 - 而舌头在口腔后部较低位置发出的元音,会用在带有大、重等意思的单词中,比如gargantuan(庞大的)、bold(力量大的)、humongous(极大的)。   斯坦福大学.
gargantuan 丰盛的 Somnus罂粟 6级 2009-07-29  字典上有很全面的  〃嗳→祢/tp 1级 2009-07-31  金山词霸中可以找到翔羽天翼 3级 2009-08-07.

list.abs: ...注:mind有一意项为To object to; dislike. 所以对应的很好。minute gargantuan 小的巨大的minutia essential point/vital feature细节，琐事要点/重要特征.
Convertibility of the currency is a gargantuan barrier ., 货币的可兑换性就是一个巨大的障碍.
肥大性歯肉炎：hyperplastic gingivitis肥大性乳腺炎：gargantuan mastitis被嚢炎：capsulitis
there was enough elbow room in this gargantuan aquarium for all kinds of surprises to emerge .在这个巨大的水族箱里，有足够的活动空间让各种惊喜出现。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Gargantua, the name of a voracious giant in Rabelais' book of the same name (1534), + -an

entry.def: If you say that something is gargantuan, you are emphasizing that it is very large.

means.word_mean: 1. of great mass; huge and bulky;
